page.title: 13LANDSCAPE - Lydham/More
page.content: Our rural{landscape}is level pasture and arable encircled by hills, highest is 1400 feet; some with mixed wood or grazing. Rocky slopes contain old quarries and mine workings. West Onny river runs south by Linley and More. Notable{buildings}include the parish churches Lydham and More, Linley Hall (Palladian mid C18th house) and Roveries built 1810. Farmhouses (altered inside over the years to provide comfort) are examples of vernacular building. More Farm,Church Farm,Partridge,Upper Bent, and Newton Farms have timber-framing. Cottages are built where needed for workers;the oldest in limestone rubble stonework, as Bromleysmill,Lydham Mill, Avenue & Linley Lodges, & Old Smithy. Newer are brick-built, but all are set in well-tended gardens and many house those who work in the area.
